intro: Terminalia franchetii var. franchetii, commonly known as the African wild almond, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elliptical leaves with a slightly toothed margin. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers followed by edible, almond-like fruits that are used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
